00036 // virtual base class for other variable expressions
00037 class variable
00038 {
00039         public:
00040         //const char* str();
00041         virtual std::string str() const = 0;
00042         
00043         virtual bool operator == (const variable &that) const = 0;
00044         virtual bool operator <  (const variable &that) const = 0;
00045         
00046         // returns the scope in which this array variable was declared
00047         virtual SgScopeStatement* getScope() const=0;
00048         
00049         // returns a SgExpression that corresponds to an access of this variable
00050         virtual SgExpression* toSgExpression() const=0;
00051         
00052         // returns true if this variable is global and false otherwise
00053         virtual bool isGlobal() const=0;
00054         
00055         virtual ~variable() {}
00056 };
00057 
00058 // type of variable ids, their sets and maps of sets
00059 class varID : public variable
00060 {
00061         public:
00062         std::vector<SgInitializedName *> components;
00063         // Annotations associated with this variable
00064         std::map<std::string, void*> annotations;
00065         SgType* varType;
00066         // special variables do not have associated SgInitializedName nodes and thus, we just give them a name
00067         std::string name;
00068         
00069         varID(){ }
00070         
00071         varID(std::string name)
00072         {
00073                 this->name = name;
00074                 varType = NULL;
00075                 genID();
00076         }
00077         
00078         // creates a varID from an SgNode s.t. isValidVarExp(n) is true
00079         varID(SgNode *n)
00080         {
00081                 bool ret = init(n);
00082                 ROSE_ASSERT(ret);
00083                 genID();
00084         }
00085         
00086         varID(SgInitializedName *name)
00087         {
00088                 bool ret = init(name);
00089                 ROSE_ASSERT(ret);
00090                 genID();
00091         }
00092         
00093         // pre-condition: isValidVarExp(refExp) evaluates to true
00094         varID(const SgExpression *exp)
00095         {
00096                 bool ret=init(exp);
00097                 ROSE_ASSERT(ret);
00098                 genID();
00099         }
00100         
00101         varID(const varID& that) : variable()
00102         {
00103                 init(that);
00104         }
00105         
00106         // initializes this object from the given varID
00107         bool init(const varID& that);
00108         
00109         // initializes this object from the given expression (assumed that isValidVarExp(n) is true)
00110         // returns true on success, false on failure
00111         bool init(SgNode *n);
00112         
00113         // initializes this object from the given expression (assumed that isValidVarExp(exp) is true)
00114         // returns true on success, false on failure
00115         bool init(const SgExpression *exp);
00116         
00117         // initializes this object from the given SgInitializedName (assumed that isValidVarExp(name) is true)
00118         bool init(SgInitializedName* name);
00119         
00120         void operator = (const variable &that);
00121         
00122         // recursive function that pulls the SgInitializedNames of all the SgVarRefExps inside this SgDotExp
00123         // returns true on success, false on failure
00124         bool collectDotComponents(const SgDotExp* dotExp);
00125         
00126         // returns the scope in which this variable was declared
00127         // for compound variables (i.e. those composed of dot expressions), it is the scope of the leftmost name
00128         SgScopeStatement* getScope() const;
00129         
00130         // returns a SgExpression that corresponds to an access of this variable
00131         SgExpression* toSgExpression() const;
00132         
00133 protected:
00134         // returns a SgExpression that corresponds to an access of this variable, including only the components
00135         // at or after the iterator rest into the components vector
00136         SgExpression* toSgExpression_rec(std::vector<SgInitializedName *>::const_iterator rest) const;
00137         
00138 public:
00139         // returns true if the given expression is one that can be represented as a variable in our representation
00140         static bool isValidVarExp(const SgNode* exp);
00141         static bool isValidVarExp(const SgExpression* exp);
00142         static bool isValidVarExp(const SgInitializedName* exp);
00143         
00144 protected:
00145         static bool isValidVarExp_rec(const SgExpression* exp);
00146         
00147 public:
00148         void add(SgInitializedName *name);
00149         
00150         // Adds the given annotation to this variable. Returns true if this causes the variable's
00151         // annotation state to change and false otherwise.
00152         bool addAnnotation(const std::string& aName, void* annot);
00153         
00154         // Remove the given annotation from this variable. Returns true if this variable
00155         // previously had this annotation and false otherwise.
00156         bool remAnnotation(const std::string& aName);
00157         
00158         // Remove the given annotation from this variable. Returns true if this variable
00159         // previously had this annotation and false otherwise.
00160         bool remAllAnnotations();
00161         
00162         // Swap this variables annotations, removing [fromAnnotName -> fromAnnotVal] and replacing
00163         // it with [toAnnotName -> toAnnotVal]. Returns true if this was successful (i.e. the variable
00164         // does have the [fromAnnotName -> fromAnnotVal] annotation) and false otherwise.
00165         // If the replacement occurs and this variable already has an annotation named
00166         //    toAnnotName, this annotation's value is replaced by toAnnotVal.
00167         bool swapAnnotations(const std::string& fromAnnotName, void* fromAnnotVal,
00168                              const std::string& toAnnotName, void* toAnnotVal);
00169         
00170         // If this variable has the annotation with the given name, returns it. Otherwise, returns NULL.
00171         void* getAnnotation(const std::string& aName) const;
00172         
00173         // If this variable has the annotation with the given name, returns true. Otherwise, returns false.
00174         bool hasAnnotation(const std::string& aName) const;
00175         
00176         // If this variable has the annotation with ANY name in the given set, returns true. Otherwise, returns false.
00177         bool hasAnyAnnotation(const std::set<std::string>& aNames) const;
00178         
00179         // If this variable has the annotation with EACH name in the given set, returns true. Otherwise, returns false.
00180         bool hasAllAnnotations(const std::set<std::string>& aNames) const;
00181         
00182         // Returns the total number of annotations associated with this variable
00183         int numAnnotations() const;
00184         
00185         // Returns the full map of all the annotations associated with this variable
00186         const std::map<std::string, void*>& getAnnotations() const;

00231         bool isCompilerGenerated() const;

00242         // Unique ID generation and access functionality
00243         // the maximum ID that has been generated for any variable
00244         static long globalMaxID;
00245         // the unique ID of this variable
00246         long ID;
00247         // generates a new ID for this variable and stores it in ID
00248         void genID();
00249
